page.title: 13Clay Cross Works
page.content: The biggest employer in Clay Cross is{Clay Cross Works.}The factory spreads over 45 acres and {employs 500 {people.}Each employee works 46 hours a week. The factory was built in{1837}by {George Stephenson}who also built the "Clay Cross Tunnel". George Stephenson was given a contract for a railway line to be put down between Leeds and Derby.While he was digging the "Clay Cross Tunnel" he noticed all the{coal {and minerals}in the ground so he bought much of the land round Clay Cross. The works make{ductile pipes, {fittings}and{engineering castings mainly for the{Clean Water Authorities to supply houses with fresh water. Only 1% or 2% of the products is exported - mainly to Spain and Italy. Not much is exported because the pipes are too bulky to transport far.
